snippet: Voters in Tanzania, usually one of Africa’s most peaceful nations, will take part in the most heavily contested presidential vote in the nation’s history on Sunday.
abstract: Upcoming election in Tanzania is one of biggest tests in country's 50-plus-year history as it is first credible challenge to governing Party of Revolution's one-party rule; race between party's presidential candidate John Magufuli and challenger Edward Lowassa is too close to call, which has raised concerns about whether party will relinquish control peacefully should it lose.
lead_paragraph: Voters in Tanzania, usually one of Africa’s most peaceful nations, will take part in the most heavily contested presidential vote in the nation’s history on Sunday.

headline.print_headline: Half-Century of One-Party Rule Is Put to a Vote in Tanzania
headline.main: Election in Tanzania to Challenge Half a Century of One-Party Rule
